Package spielwitz.biDiServer

Class Client

java.lang.Object
spielwitz.biDiServer.Client
public abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
The client that can send requests to the server and can receive notifications from the server.
Author:
spielwitz

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int CLIENT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT
    The default client socket time out (10 seconds)

  • Field Details

    • CLIENT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT

      public static final int CLIENT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT
      The default client socket time out (10 seconds)
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      protected Client​(ClientConfiguration config, boolean establishNotificationSocket, java.lang.String locale)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      config - Client configuration
      establishNotificationSocket - True, if a notification socket shall be established. Not possible for administration and activation user
      locale - Language into which the client converts text properties. "de-DE" or "en-US"

  • Method Details

    • getBuild

      protected abstract java.lang.String getBuild()
      Get the client build.
      Returns:
      The client build

    • onConnectionStatusChanged

      protected abstract void onConnectionStatusChanged​(boolean connected)
      Called when the connection status of the notification socket changes.
      Parameters:
      connected - True, if the notification socket is connected and can receive notifications

    • checkServerClientBuild

      protected abstract ServerClientBuildCheckResult checkServerClientBuild​(java.lang.String serverBuild)
      Check if the client and server builds are compatible.
      Parameters:
      serverBuild - Server build
      Returns:
      If the builds are compatible plus the minimum required client build

    • onNotificationReceived

      protected abstract void onNotificationReceived​(Notification notification)
      Is called when a notification is received through the notification socket.
      Parameters:
      notification - The notification

    • start

      public void start()
      Start the client. Also establishes a notification socket, except for user _ADMIN and the activation user.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the client from the server.

    • getConfig

      public ClientConfiguration getConfig()
      Get the client configuration.
      Returns:
      The client configuration.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Checks if the notification socket is connected.
      Returns:
      True, if connected.

    • getUserId

      public java.lang.String getUserId()
      Get the ID of the user who is connected through this client.
      Returns:
      The user ID

    • activateUser

      public static Tuple<ClientConfiguration,​ResponseInfo> activateUser​(PayloadResponseMessageChangeUser userActivationData, java.lang.String locale, java.lang.String clientBuild)
      Activate a user.
      Parameters:
      userActivationData - User activation data
      locale - Language locale
      clientBuild - Client build
      Returns:
      Client configuration and response message info

    • changeUser

      public Response<PayloadResponseMessageChangeUser> changeUser​(PayloadRequestMessageChangeUser payload)
      Create or update a user. The user needs to be activated in another step.
      Parameters:
      payload - The user data
      Returns:
      The information needed to activate the user.

    • shutdownServer

      public ResponseInfo shutdownServer()
      Shut down the server.
      Returns:
      Response information

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • getDataSetInfosOfUser

      public Response<PayloadResponseGetDataSetInfosOfUser> getDataSetInfosOfUser​(java.lang.String userId)
      Get all information about all data sets related to a user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      Returns:
      Information about the data sets.

    • createDataSet

      public ResponseInfo createDataSet​(DataSet dataSet)
      Create a new data set. There must not be an existing data set with the same ID.
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The data set.
      Returns:
      Response information

    • updateDataSet

      public ResponseInfo updateDataSet​(DataSet dataSet)
      Update an existing data set.
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The data set.
      Returns:
      Response information

    • deleteDataSet

      public ResponseInfo deleteDataSet​(java.lang.String id)
      Delete a data set. No error is returned, if the data set does not exist.
      Parameters:
      id - The data set ID.
      Returns:
      Response information.

      Returns:
